Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice property!”
Reviews.Author: thekeone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for business. Upgraded to a suite due to Hilton Gold rewards, and also received free internet, breakfast coupon, and drink voucher. Very impressive. The rooms are nice and spacious, fairly updated with flat screen tvs. The hotel also has a McCormick and Schmick's in the lobby with their amazing happy hour food specials. It got crowded quickly, but that's typical for those specials. Check-in and Check-out were both a breeze and the customer service was solid all the way around. Be sure to park in the right garage though as I ended up parking in the Embassy Suites garage around the corner. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Compassionate during our time of need”
Reviews.Author: Catherine B
Reviews.Content: My Mother had just passed away and the city was hosting a large event. This was one of a few hotel rooms avaible. We were traveling in a hurry, and the hotel staff saw to it that all of our needs were met. This included a most comfortable bed and room with amenities, easy access to the funeral home, on and off ramps to the interstate and the city. The free breakfast buffet every morning was very good with the fresh fruit and a variety of food.

Reviews.Title: “Very Underrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: djmargrave
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hilton during the NFL Combine. They reserved my room for a late check-in (10:00 pm). The staff were very helpful and courteous. The valet was prompt both in and out. Parking runs $30 a night. There was free wi-fi in the lobby, but not in the rooms. However, from room 515 I was able to access a wireless connection from somewhere nearby with blazing speed for free. The rooms were spacious and recently updated. The picture of old cheesy bedspreads on their website is outdated. The Artsgarden and Circle City Mall were only a few blocks away. Access to the Skywalk is right across the street behind the TJ Maxx. I would definintely stay here again. For the price you can't beat it. I used $30 bonus bucks and won a Priceline bid for $50.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: InBrown5
Reviews.Content: We booked the room through Hotwire at a great price and got a large two room suite with a nice living room. The only thing missing was a mini-fridge (but the ice machine wasn't too far away from our room). The hotel was peaceful and quiet for a Saturday night and I can't recall hearing any noise from other guests until the next morning. We had to pay to park, but that is to be expected in downtown Indy. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Rude and snide service”
Reviews.Author: indy4life2012
Reviews.Content: The room itself was huge, but had wallpaper peeling, dirty floors, smoke detector hanging by a wire, and the radio was broken. We called down to the front desk for a replacement radio and some towels and were met with snide remarks, condescending attitude, and an arrogance beyond description. We had to wait over an hour to receive a new clock radio and some towels. The poor house-keeping employee felt so bad that we had waited so long, but she had just been told by the front desk of our needs. The staff at this hotel also lied and told our party that the parking was free if we parked our car ourselves. It cost $30.00 to park our car where they had told us to.

Reviews.Title: “Overall the room was fine, but breakfast was a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: Whitleywalker
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hilton in the past, and again, had a very nice room. We were given a handicapped accessible room (don't know why) and it was humongous! There was a downside though – the bathroom is very large and as there was not heat source, it was COLD. I was tempted to turn on the hair dryer just to warm it up a little. Otherwise, the room was nice, bed comfortable, linens very nice, down comforter was cozy. We were lucky to be able to take time in the morning before our medical appointment to eat breakfast in the hotel. That’s where it all went very bad. It appeared to me that the staff was busy doing everything BUT seeing to the needs of the patrons. We stood for nearly 5 minutes at the entrance before any one would seat us. Someone actually walked up and asked us if we were being seated (it was very obvious we WEREN’T), then looked over and saw the waitress half a room away walking toward us and said, “someone will be right with you”. Well, why didn’t YOU seat us? Then the waitress did all but force us to choose the breakfast buffet. We didn’t bite on that and she looked obviously perturbed. We ordered coffee and I watched her wander all over the restaurant, doing everything BUT getting our coffee or the coffee for the guest next to us (who made the wise decision to go for the bird in the hand and eat off the buffet). After waiting 10 minutes for the waitress to return with our coffee and to take our order (was she testing how long our resolve would hold out against the buffet?), we got up and left. HIGHLY disappointed in the breakfast restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: AmyH605
Reviews.Content: I took a chance and purchased this hotel on Hotwire. It turned out great! The room we ended up with was a suite with a living room attached. The room was very clean and had a lot more space than most hotel rooms. It is very centrally located in indy as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: SteveDesign
Reviews.Content: I was given a handicapped accessible room which I didn’t turn down due to the large size, complete with a adjacent living room set up and an enormous bath with shower stall and tub. All seemed a bit oversized actually but who’d complain about too big? The TV was actually too small for the size of the room and channels IMO were limited but the room was quiet and the drapes provided enough darkening so sleep wasn’t an issue. The bed was very comfortable too. The hotel feels slightly dated in most areas except the lobby which is unfortunately awkward in its layout and doesn't provide any decent places to sit like most hotels- it’s a glorified corridor really and very tight at the reception desk. Water is provided in the lobby which is a nice amenity. The indoor pool was noisy with screaming children so I didn't use it (I guess I am showing my age here as echo-ey screaming and cannonballs no longer qualify as a great time) but the workout room was better than average which doesn’t really mean anything particularly grand, just adequate. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful granting me a 1pm check-out which I greatly appreciated as a business meeting went late. I’d stay again and can forgive the somewhat dowdy nature of the room and other minor deficiencies due to the overall enjoyment of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, but the Neighbors had a Better Stay”
Reviews.Author: FortWayne_INTeel
Reviews.Content: I travel to Indy on a semi-regular basis, so I have stayed at many of the downtown hotels. The Hilton ranks near the top. My room was really more of a suite; it had both a bedroom and living room, separated by french doors. Everything in the room was comfortable, from the sofa to the chairs to the beds. When you consider the fact that I only paid $60 for the room (look for a 3 1/2 star downtown hotel on hotwire), I really could not have asked for any more. However, the room is not the only thing to like about the Hilton. There are two restaurants attached to the hotel. In addition, the hotel is centrally located, and within walking distance of nearly any downtown attraction. The staff was friendly and efficient; check-in and check-out took no more than two minutes. Parking is a bit spicy ($22 per night), but I suppose that is to be expected in a downtown hotel. The only issue I had was that the neighbors seemed to REALLY enjoy their room. Their amorous outbursts could be heard throughout the halls and into my room until the wee hours of the morning. Headboard knocking, skin slapping, the whole nine yards. I don't know if any amount of sound insulation could have muffled their good time, but I was wishing for something at about 2:30 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: damommy
Reviews.Content: I started staying here after I got a great deal a few months ago. I have been here 4 times since october and I'm writing this review from my comfy bed right now. Takes about 3 minutes to check in and I've always gotten upgraded. The staff is very helpful and have great hospitality (and there are a couple pieces of "eye candy" at the front desk too!.....don't mind me). Really though, I love it here. The rooms I've stayed in are HUGE, clean, and comfortable. Room service is fast.....but the food was just so-so. The front desk arranged a horse carriage company to meet us at the lobby doors and we loved it. My kids love the indoor pool and hot tub on the top floor. All in all, as long as the staff remains friendly, I will be back each and every time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Large comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: CRMays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Indianapolis downtown Hilton over New Year's weekend to celebrate our anniversary. This Hilton is know for having some of the most spacious hotel rooms in Indy. Not only are they large, but they are very comfortable. It was a busy weekend in the hotel, but the staff was courteous. This hotel also has a couple of great restaurants including a very good McCormick & Schmicks. It is also within walking distance to many other restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: DrVille
Reviews.Content: The Hilton in downtown Indy is a very nice hotel -- very well kept with clean, spacious rooms. The staff is friendly and courteous, and the fitness center and indoor swimming pool are great. The hotel is in an ideal location within walking distance to many of the downtown attractions -- just a few blocks from Circle Center Mall, restaurants and Bankers Life Fieldhouse for the Pacers games. Will definitely stay at the Hilton for all of our trips to Indy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: siestakeyrich
Reviews.Content: Spacious clean room terrific staff we will stay again. Very upscale downtown place with little difference from the more expensive Conrad where we have stayed before in Indy. Glad the Cards beat Butler.

Reviews.Title: “Badly needs complete renovation”
Reviews.Author: eokauai
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like it has not been redone in 25 years. Everything looks worn and out of date. I didn't like that there was a large space under the door. The service was not very good either, i asked for something to be brought up and it never arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Bob I
Reviews.Content: This is a centrally located hotel with access to key features of the city. Accommodations were standard in nature but clean and well kept. Staff is friendly and helpful. Parking garage is under construction and a bit of a wreck at this point. Only one restaurant (the more expensive one) was open at our Sunday evening arrival - food is good but somewhat pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in the heart of Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: I82X73
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean place with a good staff. It is in gthe heart of downtown Indianapolis, near the mall and the Convention Center. The rooms are clean and well-maintained. Air conditioning is good. Room service may run late into the afternoon, so don't expect a clean room right away some days. Check-in and check-out was efficient. A good breakfast buffet is available, though a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a downtown Indianapolis business trip”
Reviews.Author: JabberwockyBeast
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location if you have meetings in the center of Indianapolis. Just off Monument Circle, the hotel is centrally located with large rooms and a helpful staff. The breakfast buffet is not incredible, but better than most. It includes made-to-order omelets, waffles and pancakes. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. Would stay again if in town on business.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton's 120 West Market Fresh Grill Restraunt”
Reviews.Author: TNtravelers03
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the best dinner of our vacation at this restaurant. My wife had a nice stake and I had one of the best salmon dishes I have ever eaten. We will try this again next time we're in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Palatial Rooms”
Reviews.Author: triplover555
Reviews.Content: This hotel has large suite rooms that are great for families. The location is ideal- near all attractions! Staff is very helpful. Rooms are updated and comfortable! A must stay if life takes you to Indy!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: When I think of a good hotel stay, this is it. Nothing stands out in my mind, and that's a good thing. A very good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice.”
Reviews.Author: kitschy
Reviews.Content: Decent sized rooms, although not super clean and a little run-down. Nice lobby, convenient location. I did have some customer service issues so I can't give them more than three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and HUGE rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lenebene
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super nice. The hotel is close to my client and very close to lots of places to eat. McCormick and Schmidt is in the lobby of the hotel. They have a wonderful happy hr special. The hotel rooms are very spacious and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: kaffy2771
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the driveway, I was greeted by the Valet. He asked if i was checking in and if I wanted to park my car or have it Valet'd. I wanted to park it myself. He wasn't upset that I wanted to do that, and gave me great instructions on where to go. I went in and checked in without any issues. The room was very spacious. I had double bed suite, and going into the next room were a pair of french doors. The other room consisted of the work desk, another flat screen TV and lounging furniture. My only complaint about the room, was the HVAC was in the other room, and there weren't any vents in the sleeping part of the room so the cool air that was blowing was mostly in the living space and not in the sleeping quarters. I like it very cool when I sleep, and the way the room was set up, this didn't happen. The breakfast buffet was delicious and had a wide variety of goodies to choose from for breakfast. Beautiful hotel, and the staff was very very friendly and courteous. I'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Always Trust the Hilton Brand”
Reviews.Author: ICanTravelPanama
Reviews.Content: When you travel a lot as I do (tour operator) you get used to certain things and hotels are very important in the overall enjoyment of a destination whether on business or pleasure. The Hilton brand is one I trust, anywhere. I know what to expect and look forward to my stays. My favourite is of course the bed. Always a perfect sleep. I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom King Suite this time. Nice suite with office desk, sofa, flatscreen tv and wetbar with coffee machine and fridge in one room, big bathroom with lots of counter space (I hate not having counter space for my own stuff), big fluffy towels and Peter Thomas Roth clinical skin care products and big bedroom with their signature Hilton bed, flatscreen tv. Ironing board and iron. The only complaint I had was no safe, bathrobe or slippers. Now perhaps I am spoiled, but I really do enjoy getting into a nice fluffly bathrobe and slippers after a shower. As to safes, well I think they should be in every hotel room in every hotel now so this was a bit of a surprise. They do have them at the front desk but I prefer to have them in my room for my netbook, cameras and papers. Check in was a breeze, as it always is. The hotel is located less than two blocks from a big shopping center called Circle Mall and just a few blocks from the big convention center. I had room service while here - very quick and food was great! They do have a pool and spa and hot tub as well as gym and business center.

Reviews.Title: “If the little things matter, then this property should matter when you're planning a trip to Indianapolis.”
Reviews.Author: wmarkwhitlock
Reviews.Content: Hotel grounds: Immaculate. Great first impression. Front drive looked almost polished. A great contrast to all of the pre-Super Bowl construction. Lobby: The automatic revolving door is a right squeeze for a carry-on roller and computer bag. I wish the hotel employed a door attendant. Valets seem to open doors when not involved with drivers. Several guests arriving at the same time struggled to enter. Checkin: My reservations were made by an event planner and not through the hotel. There were some hiccups because of that. However DEION went above and beyond to solve the problems caused by the event planner. I am VERY grateful. MEETING ROOM: We had a series of meetings in Circle City 5. The room was perfect. Seriously. It was as if Adrian Monk went through the water service, placement of the mints, pens and paper, and arrangement of the chairs. Wow! The technology in the room was flawless. I have used many meeting rooms in my travels and I have NEVER had a conference room that was this well appointed and easy-to-use. ROOM: The same person who inspected my conference room must have inspected my guest room. If only I could've stayed longer. BED: Perfect TV: Finally! A widescreen TV in a hotel that changes aspect ration depending on the signal! No stretched and pixilated low def signals. No squeezed or microscopic HD signals. Kudos! SECURITY: My hat is off to GENNY for safeguarding the conference room. I had to run downstairs after setting up my equipment. I did NOT have a keycard to the room, so I left it cracked so I could re-enter. GENNY spotted this and locked the door, left a note explaining why, and gave me information on how to contact her when I returned. Above and beyond. Valet: I did not valet, however another man in my company considered it. He was quoted $20/day. Nearby public parking (with no in/out privileges is $10/day) He asked the valet what the statue nearby was about. He said, "Oh, it's some tourist thing." Poor answer. I found the valet staff to be kind and proficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Indy option”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: Based on the TA reviews I saw, I was a bit iffy on this hotel. But because of the room size & price combo (along with a Southwest/Hilton point offer) I decided to book a room for one night. We arrived earlier than we had anticipated, parked, and decided to try to just check in early (we arrived at about 1-1:30pm). The two gentlemen at the front desk were very friendly and professional. We checked in early and headed up to our room. I booked a 2 Queen Bed Deluxe Room knowing that there would be four adults sharing the room after attending an event at the fairgrounds. The room was pretty large/long, size wise larger than I anticipated. When you walk in, the first area you enter is the bedroom area. Our bedroom had the two beds and an older looking dresser with a flat screen tv on it. Beyond that through french doors is the living room area that had a desk, couch, chair, & one of the tvs. The windows in this area overlooked parts of downtown (we faced the Conrad & Sheraton). Off the bedroom area is the bathroom. Between the bathroom & bedroom was a countertop with a sink. We didn't use this second sink much, but I guess it's a good use of space? It seemed kind of random, but maybe it is useful if multiple people are getting ready at the same time in the morning? I found no problem with the cleanliness, smell, condition, etc of our room. I didn't love the decor, it seemed dated although not old (confusing but think of buying a grandma-floral couch, someone still sells them...). The parking fee was typical for the downtown hotels. Not cheap, but it is what it is. The view from our room wasn't stellar but it wasn't awful. Indianapolis in January isn't really the most beautiful though. The location worked well for us. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to do downtown. Cabs were plentiful in front of the hotel for heading beyond downtown. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great room sizes”
Reviews.Author: PE1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 night at recent Drum Corps International championships which was being held at Lucas Oil Stadium. Hotel is ideally located and an easy 5/6 block walk to the venue. Also of convenience is the airport Indygo service which stops on the junction right opposite the hotel. Hotel itself is large over 19 floors with the top floor housing the indoor pool and hot tub which was small but clean and nice facility. Hot tub was rather too hot though! Changing rooms including lockers and shower also useful and plenty of towels available. Public areas are spacious and lobby nicely done out with helpful front desk staff. Small shop for drinks snacks, gifts and toiletries just off the reception area but prices not cheap as you would expect. One hot tip is to get your bottled water from T J Maxx store right oppsite where it is $1.19 for the exact same water the hotel charges $3 for from that shop mentioned. Small business centre downstairs free to guests was useful and there is plenty of cenvention type space wth smaller meeting rooms on each floor in the centre Had a queen queen deluxe room which had a separate seating area with sofa bed, chair and large desk as well and two flat screens, one in each area. Bathroom slightly dissapointing in relation to size of room overall but functional enough and decent enough shower over the bath. Beds very comfortable with mattress toppers and plenty of pillows. Air con worked fine but rather noisy and also too much noise via the air con shafts presumably from other rooms etc. Presumably this a hang over from its previous situation as an office block I guess? 6 lifts service the hotel and no problem waiting for one at any time whether busy or not Seafood restaurant and 120 Market St restauramt both off the lobby and a good room service menu giove plenty of dining and drink options on your doorstep, but as you are right in downtown, a simple walk one or two blocks gives you hugely more options, including access to the Circle Centre mall which is only one blocks walk away. try Rock Bottom Brewery next to the Conrad hotel for some decent beer and a decent enough menu. Weber Grill nice food and Ok staff but not as friendly If you get a decent price as well for this hotel then certainly worth considering - we booked through Hotels.com but the Hilton site i believe has a prioce promise so may be worth booking direct

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Downtown Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Whitleywalker
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful king-bed room on the 9th floor. The room was very spacious, room lay out was pleasing, the bed & linen was very comfortable and the towels were soft and fluffy ~ all pluses in my book! Check in was very easy and the staff was welcoming and efficient. The location is excellent: right between Monument Circle and the Statehouse. If you need a room in Indianapolis, I recommend the Hilton Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Standard, high end Hilton”
Reviews.Author: APMD
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Indianapolis. Rooms are nice, clean. Bathrooms slightly on the dated side. Pool is nice, on the top floor. When we arrived at 10PM on Saturday night we had no trouble finding free overnight parking across the street from the hotel garage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for a good Nights Rest”
Reviews.Author: Traveurcpl
Reviews.Content: Just needed a place for the night. Stayed on the 14th floor, not much of a view. Room was OK, nothing special. Bathroom was clean, beds were soft, nothing really to write home about. The carpet felt unclean, kept our socks on. If you need a place to stay this is OK. Parking is $$ about $18 a night. I asked for Executive level and told they don't have one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Indy_Fan_Man
Reviews.Content: Was on business in the downtown area and the wife & grandkids wanted to go on the road with me for a couple days before school starts again. As always we were greeted by the staff of the Hilton and welcomed back as a regular. The room was very clean and when we needed a couple extra pillows they were there before you knew it. We missed breakfast so we went for the lunch buffet. Again the best I have ever had at a hotel for the choices and the price, and I stay over 160 nights a year in hotels. The location is tops for doing things in the downtown area and the staff is great at giving suggestions of things to do. If you have several people, book one of the corner suites, you will not be disappointed. They are a 1 bedroom 2 bath suite, very large and lots of window space to view the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in supurb location”
Reviews.Author: kentdan1
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Indianapolis on several occasions on business and always stay in the downtown area. I was there for three days in July at the Hilton. The hotel is really nice with competitive prices and plenty of the ammenities that we have come to expect. It is a converted office building and as such the hallways and most rooms are very large. We stayed on the 17th floor in a huge two room suite with a great view of the city in two directions. The bed was very comfortable and having two bathrooms was very nice. The work out room was ideal. Pool is okay but does not open to outdoors so we did not use it. It would be fine for someone with kids. Hotel staff very friendly and responsive and the restaurant was great. My wife travelled with me and had no problems finding things to do in walking distance including a huge mall. Many good restaurants in all price catagories. Only thing not great was the weather was hot which the hotel could not control. Eat at the Weber Grill Restaurant one block east.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is gross.”
Reviews.Author: Coloradogirly
Reviews.Content: I agree with another reviewer in that this hotel is an embarrassment to the Hilton brand. Although it's a non-smoking room, it smells of stale smoke, and, other than an ugly granite counter top in the bathroom, the hotel appears that it hasn’t been updated in the last 20 years (e.g., outdated furniture, color scheme, and stained carpet). For $175 per night, I expected a decent room, not a room that looks like it a motel. I do not recommend this hotel and will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Luxurious But Great Value”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: The Hilton in downtown Indianapolis will not cloak you in 5 star luxury, but for value & location, it can't be beat. The rooms are large, clean, & accommodating, but the rooms, hallways, lobby etc, have not been renovated since the early 1980s. My guess is that there will be an overhaul of this hotel before the next Super Bowl & that prices will go up. That will be too bad, because I do not expect hotels in Indy to compete with Saint Tropez & the Hilton fit the bill for reasonable lodging. The Conrad across the street was $100 more per night! The service @ the Hilton was young, unpolished, & immature but I didn't expect concierge like help. This Hilton was perfect for our needs

Reviews.Title: “An Embarrassment for the Hilton Brand”
Reviews.Author: afineguy
Reviews.Content: Wow...this hotel is a Hilton in name only and not worth the rate I paid. I am Hillton Gold Honors member and I have stayed in Hampton Inn's that are far superior to this hotel. Some converns: - A staff that appears to more concerned with their own conversations rather than guest services. The gum smaking desk clerk at checkout was a particular "joy" - A funky smell in the lobby that only seemd to get worse each night - this hotel is VERY tired. Peeling/melted paint in the bathroom, peeling wallpaper, frayed towels. Just tired. Just not a nice experience. I should have splurged for the Conrad or gone with any other Hilton brand that are all within walking distance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Suska13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding in the area and the hotel was perfectly located downtown with a short walk to everything you needed- the mall, shops, breweries, downtown attractions ( Capitol, Canal Walk, etc). And the zoo is also a quick drive away. The Childrens Museum is also a must and only a 10 min drive or so. Tim and the rest of the front desk were so accomodating and really helped us out when needed. Its a great hotel with a lovely indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room, beautiful decor”
Reviews.Author: ilikemarkers
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find how nice our hotel was, as we were not expecting it to be anything out of the ordinary for a Hilton. However, when we checked into our room, we were greeted with a complimentary room upgrade to a very nice suite, and spacious main room and bath. Plenty of room for business and relaxation. We wished that we had this room in many of the other cities we have stayed at in the past!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: michtraveler1969
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is located right downtown in a great location and overall it was a very pleasant stay. Parking was easy and convenient in the Hilton's underground garage. I believe the parking fee was $18 for overnight which isn't great but not outragious considering the location. Check-in was handled quickly and professionally and i was sent on my way. The hallways and public areas are attractive and well cared for. The room was incredibly huge especially for a downtown location. There was a huge area that contained the bed, desk, couch and end tables. There was a short hallway leading to the equally huge bathroom area. I wouldn't call the room's decor totally up to date. The carpet was older but clean as was the couch, desk and tables. The bed was extremely comfortable and a nice but undersized flat screen tv was also featured. The bathroom also hadn't been updated recently but was very clean and that fact really didn't bother me at all. I didn't hear any noise at all from the outside and i had a great night of sleep. The location is ideal with all the downtown nightlife, restaurants and tourist attractions literally within three blocks. This Hilton is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, huge rooms, and great staff”
Reviews.Author: IndyDenise
Reviews.Content: I got this room for $62.00 via Hotwire and WOW! what a buy that was. Often when using Hotwire you get the worse room but we got a HUGE two room suite , very quiet and clean, with a large bathroom. But best of all was the staff, they treated us well and let us check in 5 hours early . Parking isn't cheap but you will pay for overnight parking downtown anyway..and the parking garage was safe and secure. There is also a hair salon in this hotel, they did my daughter's hair for prom They are super and her hair looked fantastic( , this is an added benefit if you are attending an event...you can get your hair done, and go back to your room to finish getting ready without stepping one foot outside ) All in all great staff and great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for Mini-marathon!”
Reviews.Author: andymattmom
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Hilton the night before the Indy 500 Mini-Marathon. The staff was very friendly. We were upgraded to a suite because of Hilton Honors status. The room was a very large 2 room queen suite with sitting area. The bath area had a sink outside and then one inside the very large bathroom. The furnishings were 'dated' but everything was clean and well kept. The towels were very nice and thick. The front desk sent extra shampoo that we requested up within 5 minutes. The night manager called to make sure things were satisfactory and to make dinner recommendations. Think the only issue was with valet parking on arrival. I really can't fault hotel as there was lots of construction and some really inexperienced travelers. People didn't know how to pull forward, quickly unload and move on. The valets were doing an outstanding job. It took less than 5 minutes to get our car after the race. After 3 years and 3 different hotels for the mini this is by far our favorite for location and overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tangentair
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are large and very well appointed but the little things are cheap like the hair dryer or the one tea bag and 2 packets of sugar substitute neither of which the maid replaced. watch for the hidden charges on the room service also. Took two trips to the front desk to get someone to fix the a/c and the maid service was not up to the quality of a Days Inn where you get free WiFi. Just not what you would expect from a Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Need to upgrade the maid service”
Reviews.Author: diinslc
Reviews.Content: First the good: The rooms are huge. I had an unexpected suite--a nice living room with couch, chair, tv and wet bar, and a separate bedroom with two more chairs and an additional t.v. across the large room from the king size bed. The room was quiet, spacious, and perfectly adequate. Since I was paying a conference rate, I couldn't complain, but I certainly wouldn't pay luxury rates for this hotel. I've never been to Indy before so I have nothing to compare it to, but the decor was dated and in sad need of an update/upgrade. The first night when I tried to open the desk drawer, the drawer panel fell off in my lap. The yellow striped wall paper reminds me of my mother's 1970s kitchen. The location seems reasonable enough. Within walking distance are the canal, the mall, and the war memorials. Since I was only here for a conference in the hotel, it's hard to tell whether this would be a good location for other events, but it appears that the major sporting arenas might be within a short walk. Now for the bad. The worst thing about the room was perfectly lousy maid service. The maids didn't arrive until mid morning or afternoon. Once I interrupted them about 3:30 still cleaning. But, I'm not sure if cleaning is an accurate description. I stayed for four nights and on various days I came back to towels not being replenished, soap not being replenished, a coffee cuip returned to the coffee maker without being cleaned, and towels cleaned but stained with makeup. In addition, the maid always closed the room up tight, turning off all lights and closing curtains making the room pitch-dark and rather disconcerting to a single woman travelling alone. The thermostat was raised to over 70 degrees. Furthermore, every day the alarm on the clock radio was turned off and the station turned to an awful rap station with vulgar lyrics. Instead of arriving to a comfortable room made ready for my arrival, I had to each day rearrange things the way I liked them, open the curtains, lower the thermostat, move the ice bucket back to its tray, and search for a tv remote. Pens disappeared and were not replenished. The only clock was in the bedroom. One would think that in a suite one would experience nice touches, fine amenities, fluffy towels, a robe, maybe even turn down service. None of this was apparant and the the lack of thorough cleaning during the stay was un-nerving. (Incidentally, I found the whole city rather dirty. Stores had dirty floors. Street people rested in doorways. Smells were unbelieveably unpleasant.) I often stay at Hiltons and trust their standards, but the standard for cleanliness and cleaning service in this hotel is the worst I've ever seen, including at some budget hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel hard to get in and out of”
Reviews.Author: LittleLassie
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Indianapolis, had to call hotel from their parking garage-no signs to lobby. Received a print out parking ticket which asked you to present to clerk at check out, which they stamped. (Leaving garage, there was no attendant. A machine received your ticket but there were no means to pay, it is added to your credit card-would have been nice to have a sign or be told by the clerk...) At check in, we were not asked if we needed help or given some needed instructions, the clerk seemed to be "too busy". The room was nice and large. The bed was new, very comfortable, had a great mattress and comfy pillows. It was a typical 3-31/2 star room. The room service, arrived promptly,the server was congenial. The price was steep and the ticket vague...the food was hotel kitchen food. The worst thing about this place is getting in and out. All the streets are one way. From the front of the hotel to the garage on the side took 20 minutes because of the one way streets, construction and traffic. It was a nightmare to get around the downtown in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Nads82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location downtown. Views from the top floor (19) of the hotel are great. I had a good visit. Valet service was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Btownboy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton through Hotwire and got a rate of 53 dollars for Christmas night. We have done this for years in Indianapolis downtown and shopped the day after Christmas at Circle Center. This year we had family and friends go along and booked rooms with us. We had such a great time. downtown Indy is awesome at Christmas... PROS- We arrived at 4pm and checked in at the front desk. We checked in really quickly!!! I had hardly time to hand my credit card before he was giving us keys. We were given a room on 8th floor corner. Was not much of a view!! small window through buildings... but holy cow this room was huge with a closet that could be a extra room and spacious.... nice comfy chairs and 2 double queens along with a great desk. We invited our friends over and had room service as no places to eat downtown were open. Room service was a little slow but hey it was Christmas night... Food was great and 8 of us ate for 130 dollars. This hotel is in great shape and was nicely decorated in lobby for Christmas...We will definitely stay again.. CONS- not many!!! just 22 dollar parking and no free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very well kept”
Reviews.Author: Eduardocm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in downtown Indianapolis, and despite you can see its age by the design/decoration, it is very well kept, has spacious and silent rooms. Above that the prices are all very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel, but rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: MrFrump
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lo going for it, ad overall it was a pleasant stay, but there were just enough inconsistencies to not rate it as highly as I typically do a Hilton property. Check-in was quick, but it was obvious the person doing it was in a hurry to either go on break or end her shift, even went so far as to have someone else finish our checkin. It's not a big deal, but I guess you normally expect some sort of "welcome to our hotel" mentality. The room was quite comfortable, clean, and spacious. Upon awaking our first morning we discovered the housekeeping staff hadn't put any caffeinated coffee in the room (and only one pack of decaf). Fine, we left a note and got some at breakfast. Housekeeping continued to fail as our room was never cleaned. The Celtics were there as well a large convention so I guess they didn't staff properly. When we called the front desk that night (where it was oddly difficult to get a person and not a recording) for a few towels and some coffee, they arrived quickly but without any sort of concern that our room had been overlooked completely. The above, combined with a couple other minor issues certainly didn't make it a negative experience, but at a downtown Hilton property, I expect a bit more. Good thing the Conrad is just around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: pacersguy31
Reviews.Content: Was in indianapolis for 4 days in November for a wedding - i'm very familiar with indianapolis and we're up there usually 6-8 times a year for Colts games/IU weekends/Indy 500, etc...so we're familiar with the city and other hotels in the area and how they compare to this one. Staying at the Hilton was a great experience - were there for a wedding in the family - we were on the 16th floor - the floors are laid out more like urban apartments or condos within the hallways...makes for quiet at night. You don't hear anything. The rooms are good size - very clean, large bathroom, super clean. Great views - this hotel is just a few blocks from the Circle and close to CircleCenter, Elmo's, Buca di Beppo, and tons of other restaurants. McCormick and Schmicks is attached to this - didn't eat there but did eat at the Hilton restaurant - pretty decent. Breakfast for 5 of us saturday morning was $120, so it's not the cheapest... Parking is going to cost approx 25/night - we parked in the parking garage attached to the back of the hotel. Essentially, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat - checkin was easy, everything was great, location is great and it's quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hilton in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: midwestlover
Reviews.Content: Subject: Hilton Indianapolis Location: Indianapolis, Indiana, United States, North America Title: Great Location in downtown Indianapolis, lots within walking distance. ID#: 83817830 My husband and I stayed here at the end of a trip to Indiana. We were really pleased with all aspects of the hotel. We were fortunate enough to recieve an upgrade for no additional fee and it was marvelous. The staff was courteous and very efficient. I would highly recommend this hotel as the location is great to take ad vantage of the many things to do in downtown. Not to mention the close proximity to the Lucas Oil Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Deaf friendly? I think not. Add on boring to that statement.”
Reviews.Author: DW1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't have a Deaf box, a box full of things that help Deaf people function in a Hearing world. There is no TTY either; it saddens and angers me that they are not open to all people. How would Deaf people wake up? We need special devices to wake us up and how do we communicate? There is no TTY. I never want to come here again and not just because of their insensitivity to the Deaf World but how boring it is. The only entertaining thing in the hotel is a shallow tiny pool on the top floor and some gym equipment. I've been to hotels with huge pools, scenery, hang-outs, and starbucks with cheaper prices. The one nice thing i say about this hotel is the sleep quality, they have very nice rooms and beds

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: 42492Escamillo
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel for the most part. The room was large and very clean and he location is close to many restaurants and nightlife. My only concern was some of the staff, who could have been friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay here while in town to run a marathon. Overall, I had a positive experience, with solid service from the staff and a clean, comfortable room. It was very nice, and though there was no “wow” experience that would make me say this stay was exceptional, I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to any other visitors. This is a great location, very convenient to the convention center, shopping, downtown restaurants and Lucas Oil Stadium. Staff: The front desk staff was courteous and efficient. Check in was very easy and the staff handled a large group of elderly folks who needed a lot of extra help as quickly as they could. Staff in the 120 West Market restaurant were fine, although when I had the buffet the waiter that the maitre d’ assigned me did not ask if I wanted coffee until I’d almost finished eating. The restaurant was not crowded and it would have been nice to have coffee with my breakfast. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and as this was time change weekend, a lady came by on Saturday evening with new alarm clocks for every room with the time set back. I thought that was a nice touch. Facilities: The lobby of the hotel is a bit small and gets crowded very easily but it is nicely furnished. It looks like it may have been updated a few years ago and it’s a little dark, but it’s okay. I liked my room a lot. I had been upgraded to a suite and it was really huge. There was a couch, a wet bar with refrigerator and a flat screen tv in the living area then there was another flat screen tv and two comfortable chairs in the bedroom. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the pillows. I did not visit the pool or the gym but heard some guests in the elevator saying they were nice. Highlights: There is free wi-fi in the lobby. Also, there is a nice water cooler featuring strawberry infused water in the lobby as well as a kiosk where you can easily print out boarding passes. The elevators were great! I know that sounds like a weird thing to say but in some large hotels, you have to wait forever for the elevators (see my review of the Hilton St Louis Ballpark!). But even though the hotel was completely full, I never had to wait more than 15 seconds for an elevator and all six were working. Areas for improvement: Although the lobby has free wi-fi, internet access is wired in the guest rooms. That’s not a big deal but I had a suite and would have liked if I could have taken the computer into the other room and the cable was very short. I was out from 8:00 am until around noon, then went out again around 2:00 pm until about 4:00 pm and my room had not been made up. It was after that when housekeeping came by and at that point, I just wanted to relax, so I just asked for some new towels. Would have been nicer to have my room cleaned when I was not in it for the majority of the day but not really a big issue. Some of the furniture (bureaus and night tables) looked a little dated. The heating/cooling unit in the bedroom would not turn on and off automatically. It ran all the time, either blowing warm air or cool air but it never stopped. I know this because I could feel the air blowing and it was also very loud. Also, the blackout drapes in my room were broken so they would not close all the way and left about a six inch gap, which let light from the street in during the night. Overall impression: This is a fine place to stay. I got a great deal on the rate and it was clean and comfortable. There were a few minor annoyances which I’ve mentioned above, none of which ruined my stay and they were so small it wasn’t even worth complaining about because I was only there two nights. However, the little details can make the difference between an average experience and an exceptional experience and although this Hilton gets most of it right, it’s not as polished as other Hilton’s I’ve stayed at. I think most people would have a decent stay here. Nearby transportation: The Indy-Go Green Line Airport Express which provides service from IND airport to downtown locations has a stop directly diagonal from the hotel. It only took a half hour to go each way and at $7 it is a lot cheaper than a cab and also more environmentally friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Indy_Fan_Man
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels about 250 nights a year all over Indiana and KY. The downtown Hilton is by far my favorite. The staff goes out of their way to make the stay wonderful and upgrade me when possible to the suite, most rooms are very large. Have had problems a couple of stays (out of about 50+) and they were quickly taken care of. My family & I spent last Christmas and New Year at the downtown Hilton due to a family member being in the hospital. Had my truck window broken out Christmas eve (the only time ever having a problem) while parked in the meter area. Russell got on the phone & found a glass company to come out on Christmas day to replace my window while Veronica (the dining room manager) came out to help clean the glass up. The Hilton was sold out for New Years eve and I had planned on moving to the Garden Inn since all the suites at the Hilton were pre-booked. Joe went out of his way to keep me in the suite so we did not have to move. Anytime I am close to the Indianapolis area, the Hilton is my home away from home. My 5 yr old grandson stays here all the time and everyone knows him, he even wanted to have (and did) his 5th birthday at the Hilton to invite all his friends from the Hilton. There breakfast is the best I have ever seen I give them 10+ rating.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: Although the reviews are mixed I found the hotel ok. I did not get upgraded which disappointed me. As a Gold level I generally get at least one upgrade. No explanation so I asked why and received a lame answer. This brings me to the one missing factor with the hotel: a disinterested front desk and a really awful valet and bell service. The valet's are just one step above surly. To a person they are disinterested in their job and more interested in chatting among themselves. The room I had was a king. It was nice sized and clean. The hotel is conveniently located in a fairly nice area. As you walk the area be prepared to deal with an endless number of homeless and panhandlers. As a city person I am used to it but for the size of Indianapolis there is a disproportionate number of agressive panhandlers.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, lobby and restaurants are great but rooms need major work”
Reviews.Author: kayedst
Reviews.Content: The lobby and restaurants downstairs will fool you into thinking there is more to come and you will be sadly disappointed. The rooms are VERY old and the hotel is not worth the price unless you spend most of your time downstairs. We could have stayed at a newer 3 star like Hilton Garden Inn/Embassy Suites, etc that would have been cheaper and nicer. The Hilton's location is great, we were there for a Colts game. In summary, the location is great and downstairs is great. Rooms aren't worth the price though. There are other hotels in the area so if they are priced similarly I would check them out first like the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dlove72
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from the Homewood Suites because Hotwire overbooked us so I can't comment on the price, but overall had a nice experience staying at this Hilton. No soap in the room and suprised there wasnt a refrigerator. Stayed in a room with 2 Queen beds with a seperate sitting area that had a sofa sleeper. Clean and spacious. We were surprised that the lobby bar opened at 4pm on a football Sunday but there are plenty of other places near by to catch the games. Just thought that was an odd time to open the bar at this time of year. I guess you really can't go wrong with a Hilton so we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: Indypair4
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at the Hilton this past weekend. We wanted to take a vacation in our own city and after looking at a lot of hotels downtown decided that the Hilton was a good choice. At check-in we found out that not only had they okayed our late check out request, but they had upgraded us to a state suite since it was our anniversary. That was the best surprise we could have gotten - the room was amazing and so romantic. I have never slept so well in a hotel bed. The Hilton is a great location - within walking distance of all of the restaurants we wanted to go and practically on the circle. If you really feel like walking the canal is a great choice! The Hilton is busy in a cool way, a lot of the other hotels we saw seemed kind of deserted at night, but at the Hilton there always seemed to be people in the lobby or having drinks at one of the restaurants. Thanks Hilton for a rockin weekend in Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: visitwisconsin
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff. We were able to get a great advance purchase price.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Vikyrodri_07
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the rooms were big! A little outdated but overall we had s nice stay! I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel and very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: retcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last summer and we decided to stay again. Everyone was very helpful and friendly, the breakfast is wonderful and big. It is a beautiful and very very clean. I seen the staff picking stuff up off the floor after guest threw it on the floor. Everyone went out of there way to make our stay very nice, We was there for 2 days and everything went great. I would tell everyone about this hotel and I have many times.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda211
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. We were in a king suite which was huge but strangely laid out - very long and narrow. The window was at the far end of the room in the bedroom area which left the living area very dark. Also, for as huge as the room was, it had a standard tub/shower combo which looked strangely out of place with the rest of the size of the room. The furniture (especially in the living area) was also rather old and slightly shabby. However, the room was very clean and the service at the hotel is good. It is also in a good location in Indianapolis, very close to the war memorial. We walked to the zoo which I would recommend - it is only a little over a mile away and an interesting walk. Room service at the hotel was very speedy and the food was good, as was the food at the breakfast buffet at the grill downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Good Food and More!”
Reviews.Author: glofish5
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Downtown Indianapolis and the Hilton was a great place to stay. It is near many good restaurants including two with entrances right in the hotel lobby. (One of the restaurants is McCormick and Schmick’s, one of our favorite chain seafood restaurants and this one was excellent.) The hotel lobby is very inviting. Our King room was large and comfortable. There was a nice view of the Capitol from a small window. My husband called it a “gun turret window” because it was so small but that was a minor flaw regarding the room. The staff was very good. We had a problem with our TV. A technician came right away and when she couldn’t fix it, she offered us another room but we didn’t want to move and then she was able to make it work. Housekeeping did a fine job, too. There are some great restaurants and historical sites nearby and there is free street parking on the weekends. We enjoyed our weekend at the Downtown Hilton very much.

Reviews.Title: “OKAY”
Reviews.Author: TreesForever
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights. It was a 13 hour flight to get there and I was famished when I arrived. Took 45 minutes before the phone was answered for room service even after I left a message to be called back (it was 4pm)--then I waited another 45 minutes before the food arrive. I always check all the amenities in the room whenever I travel and I noticed one of the bottled waters was 'opened'! Caught the maid in the hallway and she made a mad dash to get it and replace it profusely apologizing. Room itself was comfortable and clean. I ordered a box lunch to take to the office for the next day and it was ready when I left for the morning--it was also very good. The front desk hooked me up with their local cab driver which was also good. Overall it fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great staff with a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: mnkytourist
Reviews.Content: We were in Indy for the Final Four and stayed here because it was the official Duke hotel. The staff did very well in chaotic conditions. Our room was a regular king room but had a semi-separate sitting room, and both the bedroom and sitting room had TVs. Shortly after we checked in, a manager called us just to see if we were happy with the room, which I was impressed with, especially given how busy they must have been with a full hotel. The staff at the front desk and the people we ran into in the hallways and elevators were very friendly and helpful. The only negative encounter with staff was when room service called and woke us up at 9 a.m. the morning after the championship game, when they had to know that most of the hotel had been up until the wee hours of the morning celebrating Duke's victory. They called to say that they hadn't seen a hanger on our door requesting breakfast and wanted to know if we did, in fact, want breakfast. This really annoyed me -- first because they woke me up, second because we didn't put the hanger on our door precisely because we did not want breakfast, and third because when we had ordered breakfast the day before, we asked that it not be delivered until after 10:30, so they ought to have seen that we were not early risers. Speaking of breakfast, I suggest finding somewhere else to eat it. The breakfast we got through room service was mediocre and overpriced -- something like $14 for two tiny muffins, a bowl with maybe 6 chunks of fruit, plus coffee and OJ. The other main negative at the hotel was that the bed felt unstable -- whenever my partner shifted position, the whole bed shook. Not conducive to a good night's sleep. We also periodically heard loud banging noises but couldn't tell where they were coming from. Aside from those noises, the room was fairly quiet. We were on the 19th floor and heard almost nothing from the street. Overall, I would recommend the hotel. The location is great, right in the middle of downtown Indy; the rooms are big for the price; and the staff is friendly and helpful (except when they wake you up for no reason). We also really appreciated the free business center, where we were able to check our email and print our airline boarding passes. Parking is $22 a night if you park yourself in the garage next to the hotel -- seems like a lot for a city like Indianapolis, but we didn't bother to shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Conference-Idea to Product Competition-Purdue University”
Reviews.Author: Arilexis
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT HOTEL for staying. All facilties included.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: wguterbock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting; my room was paid for by the host, but the rate on the bill was $109. A real bargain. This is a big full-service hotel. My room was huge, really a suite, with a couch, chairs, desk, two TVs and a large bathroom. Everything clean. Coffee maker but no microwave or fridge. The gym is well-equipped with six cardio machines, free weights, a weight machine, and a room for stretching and floor exercise. The hotel is centrally located, close to the Civil War memorial and the Children's Museum. Bed was very comfortable. Only downside is the usual big-hotel ripoffs: charges for Internet, local calls, and $4 for a bottle of water from Fiji. Why can cheap hotels give these things away and the fancy ones insist on charging for them? The only business where you get less for paying more. I did not eat in the restaurants but the hotel food at the meeting was excellent. McCormick and Schmick's Seafood Restaurant is in the hotel and there are lots of choices within a short walk. The rate I saw may have been a special corporate rate but seemed like a bargain for this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel if you must visit Indy”
Reviews.Author: nancinmofo
Reviews.Content: The most impressive thing about this hotel is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The rooms are very clean and spacious, The bed is very warm and the hotel is very quiet. I am not a big fan of Indianapolis,but I hve to stay there a couple of times a year but if you must go there stay in this hotel. The hotel does not provide a free shuttle however and that is the only down side.

Reviews.Title: “Indy,indiana”
Reviews.Author: phyllo65
Reviews.Content: pretty nice hotel right downtown indianapolis. Within walking distance of the indy zoo,botanical gardens and several other attractions. Visit the Children's museum if you go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for New Year's Eve, Customer Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: mcwill
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Hilton on NYE for my sister-in-law's wedding. The people we dealt with prior to our arrival were very accomodating and very helpful to try and make this a great event for our family. Let me start by saying this wedding was not what most would consider "traditional". The "ceremony" was very brief in one of the king suites that were reserved for the event. The rooms were HUGE so it actually work out nicely. There was about a dozen people for this part and there was plenty of room. They did a little decorating but this part wasn't that important to the bride and groom. Everything went real well with the front desk for our early check in (although communication between hotel employees could have been a little better, we kept having to tell them we were with the wedding to get things done). As a part of the package we purchased we got a bottle of champagne in the evening and breakfast. We of course weren't palnning to be in the room for the champange delivery because of the dinner and reception that evening. I asked the front desk if it would just be delivered and left in the room.and she replied "yes". We got back to our room that evening and the bottle had not been delivered so I called the front desk and asked that they deliver it. The person on the other end was a very rude man that actually hung up on me. We were going to sleep and had no intention of even drinking the bottle that night but because it was a part of the package we wanted it delivered. Instead of calling back I went down and luckily it was a different person and she of course apologized and seemed sincere. Before I knew it a man was walking toward me with our bottle. So I guess we got what we were entitled to but why did I get hung up on and why did I have to go get it? I know my sister-in-law (the bride) had a few issues that she wasn't real happy with that concerned customer service as well but since it wasn't my experience I am not going to write about it. They also did not get their champagne. Overall great hotel, great location, incredible breakfast buffet (with a bloody mary bar!).

Reviews.Title: “a first-class experience in a first-class city”
Reviews.Author: carolynFortWayne_IN
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hilton Indianapolis which is located right near Monument Circle. We hotwired this room, yet were upgraded to a huge suite on the 17th floor with a great view of the city. The staff was friendly and prompt. Best of all, we had the pool and hot tub to ourselves for almost two hours that night - and the pool is located on the top floor of the facility with an atrium skylight. This was our first stay at his facility and would definitely return. It certainly exceeded our experiences at any one of the other downtown hotels over the years. Thank you, Hilton! Also, would recommend eating at The Weber Grill - the best prime rib I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel early and expected to store our bags. We were surprised that our room was ready to go 3 hours prior to the official check in time. The staff was very freindly. I had requested 2 extra towels and 2 bath robes prior to my arrival. When I got in my room they were not there. I called the front desk. They apologized and within 5 minutes I had the towels and the robes. The room was very large. The walk in closet was big enough to put a bed in. The bathroom had enough room for 2 people to get ready w/o being too crowded. I would rate this stay a 5 out of 5. It had friendly staff, a clean large room, good bedding. flat screen tv, and a great value. I would return to this hotel whenever I was in Indianapolis. It also had one of the best workout rooms that I have seen in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: IADbound
Reviews.Content: Spent M-R at hotel for business. Lobby is comfortable with numerous sitting areas. Reception was always prompt and receptive. Rooms are of good size and tastefully appointed. The quality television and picture was a surprising benefit. A small wet bar in the sleeping quarters proved helpful. As for issues, the walls are thin, so best if no one is next door. Maid service was spotty and very late in the day. Conference areas were acceptable—no more, no less. As implied by the title of this post, the hotel is conveniently located at Illinois and Market—near Circle Monument. Nice walks and restaurants were right there. I doubt I would insist on staying at the Indianapolis Hilton again, but it is a very good hotel for its market.

Reviews.Title: “The resception desk was extremely accommodating and thoughtful”
Reviews.Author: connieAppletonWI
Reviews.Content: When we check in I told the gentleman that our friends were from Europe, touring U.S. I asked if they could have a nice room. I wasn't so much interested in my husband and me. The desk said that he would fix them up. He gave them a suite! It was so lovely, we were jumping up and down. And, we're in our 60's. Thank you to the Hilton family.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected gem”
Reviews.Author: travelbugfromIL
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute to go to the BBQ Fest in Indie. I picked it because it was the cheapest hotel that was within walking distance to the Fest, which was in Military Park. I was just happy to get a hotel that wasn't ridiculously overpriced, but I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean. The staff were friendly, and the room was huge. I booked a room with a king bed, but I changed my preferences that day of the reservation to two queen beds. They not only accommodated my request, but they also upgraded my to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel room ever for family with young children”
Reviews.Author: busymomWestervilleOh
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by nearly everything at the Hilton. The deluxe room with 2 queen beds, and a separate "living room" with couch, desk and TV worked out great for kids. Only one block from the mall, and several restaurants nearby ( Buca di Beppa is family friendly). Nice indoor pool. Great service at all levels. We were grateful that a large group staying there had their own meeting room for breakfast, so the hotel restaurant was not swamped. The breakfast was good, although a bit pricey. My husband took the car to the Speedway, so I took the kids on the bus line just a block away up Meridian Ave a few miles to the Childrens' Museum which was fantastic. Hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Right it the heart of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Travis54
Reviews.Content: Pretty decent hotel. Right in the midle of downtown Indy only 1 block from Circle Monument. Rooms are large for beiing downton the carpet looks a little dated but the whole hotel seamed very clean. Lobby is small. Mc Cormick & Schmicks is located inside the hotel and has some great happy hour specials if you want a cheap meal. The bed was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & great location”
Reviews.Author: Yankeefan26
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night (came to do the Indy Car Experience at the track). The hotel is centrally located & easy to get to. It located a block from a mall & near all restaurants. The people at the front desk were very friendly. The room was very nice.. not overly fancy or even furnished.. but it was big & had everything we needed. We got a suite (it was $9 more than just a regular room) and it had a separate room with french doors & a sofa, flat screen TV & a desk. The bathroom was big, the bed & pillows were comfy as well. They do charge you to park.. I think it was $22 for the night. We didnt want to eat breakfast in the hotel (as it was expensive as most hotels are) so.. we asked at the front desk where a good place was.. they told us Le Pepe.. which was about 2 blocks north. It was very good & reasonable... (I-hop prices.. but much nicer). The City of Indianapolis seemed clean & not very busy (Im from the Northeast.. used to NYC). If we had more time we would have walked around. Im sure this city gets packed during the Indy 500... and there are other hotels in the area (Westin, etc).. this one got the best review that I read... and I agree.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - big room”
Reviews.Author: swilfong
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Hilton. Very nice, clean hotel and room. My room was actually the biggest room I have ever had in downtown Indy. I don't know if all of the rooms are that way but it was really nice. It was very close to everthing downtown and I believe the closest to the state capital.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE FOR A GREAT RACE”
Reviews.Author: krabby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Indy 500 weekend. The hotel could not be in a better location to downtown shopping and eating. The staff was helpful and friendly and the room was clean and updated. I had no problems here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Location for Indy!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut70
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at the Hilton after spending the day at the Indy Track. We have stayed at the hotel before. Location is very good - central to downtown and easy to drive to from outside the city. Had a great package which included parking and breakfast. Check in went very smoothly. Our room was very nice, coffe maker and a bar area in the room. Hallways seem to wander around in circles but we managed to find everything fine. We self parked which was easy since it is just behind the hotel and easy to access hotel from indoor garage. Hotel has two restaurant/bars, one if 120 Market and the other is McCormick & Schmicks. We tried either one the night we arrived, however, it was a Friday night and both were too crowded to get in at all. We headed out and went over to the Conrad hotel bar which was very nice....Capital Grille. Easy walk back and forth from Hilton. Ordered room service just prior to midnight and they were very fast and even said they were sorry for the delay when they arrived....what delay! Food was good and hot. Had breakfast at the buffet at the Market restaurant and it was very good. They make fresh pancakes, omelots and other items for you and include all the usual buffet items too. Waiter was great which I don't normally say especially since it was a buffet but he was friendly, helpful and funny. Overall, we will stay at this Hilton again. Like the location, amenities, and value.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Pay Full Price for this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlle_frontenac
Reviews.Content: After bumpy flight from Houston, I checked into this hotel using the Zip Check-In machine in the lobby, which was very convenient. Upon arriving in my room, I sat down on the bed, looked over at a pillow, and saw a short red hair. At first I thought it was a fluke, until I looked over at another pillow, and saw another hair. Alarmed, I pulled back the sheets--and saw lots of hair. I was sick to my stomach. I shudder to think where that hair might have come from. I called the lobby, and no one answered the phone. I waited a few minutes and tried again--no answer. I immediately gathered my belongings and went down to the lobby. The lady at the front desk was very apologetic. Because there were no more single king bed rooms left, she had to put me in a double room, which was no big deal. The room was huge--probably the biggest standard hotel room I've been in. However, I was disappointed when I realized I was next to the elevator shaft. I was tired from my trip and had a lot of work to do, so I just sucked it up, which brings me to my next point--no free internet. Paying for the internet wouldn't have bothered me so much if the connection had been faster. Also, the tv needs to be upgraded badly. The hotel could also offer a lot more in the way of television channels; I've stayed at bed and breakfasts that had a better selection. I managed to sleep pretty well through the night. I was able to tune out the elevator until around 6am, presumably when more people started using it. My final disappointment--probably the biggest after the hairy bed--was the shower. The shower head needs to be replaced, because only a trickle came out, literally three holes in the shower head. Very disappointing. I know it wasn't the shower pressure because water came out of the faucet as you would expect. The highlight of my stay was breakfast. I had some delicious pancakes which were served on time. I am a Hilton Honors Club member, and when I travel for business I prefer staying at Hiltons. I can usually count on the Hilton to provide a clean room and comfortable accomodations, so I was very shocked by this hotel. Even the lobby I found to be uncharacteristically drab. I would only recommend this hotel to someone who gets a deep discount, and maybe not even then. Do not pay full price for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, friendly staff, but no free internet!”
Reviews.Author: EduTravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. The check-in process was fast, the room was really clean, and everything worked well (except for a small problem with the sink, but really a small problem). The room was massive and it was very reasonably priced. The front-desk staff was very helpful and courteous. The room was quiet and clean. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. My only real gripe is the lack of free internet. This is 2009. You should have free wireless :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and extremely clean”
Reviews.Author: blakcloud
Reviews.Content: Went to a show at the conference center in Indianapolis and I chose this hotel. It was one off the more inexpensive hotels compared to others around the same area. I was pleasantly surprised on how nice this hotel was. First the location is top notch. It is right downtown and everything is within walking distance. The bus from the airport go directly in front of this hotel so that was also a nice touch. Second the staff are very friendly and helpful. They went out of their way on many occasions to help. I have never experienced such great service. This may be part of how nice the people in Indianapolis are. Never met a rude person. The room was exactly as described. Clean, comfortable bed and a great bathroom. The hotel was quiet even though there was a wedding on our floor and I didn't hear a thing. There would be no doubt that I would use this hotel again. I can't say enough nice things about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay: comfy rooms, amazing location, but O.K. Service”
Reviews.Author: OCBusinessStudent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Indianapolis in January for a conference that we had at the hotel. When we first arrived we were put into an interesting room that had little light and was placed next to the elevator shaft. I asked for us to be moved to a different room and that was done at no inconvenience. The rooms are very nice, and the location is absolutely amazing. But, we accidentally left our "do not disturb" sign up and room service did not clean up our room. After repeated calls to the lobby to have someone clean our room, it was never cleaned on that day. Other than that, the hotel was nice and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: myoffering
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated higher then I would rate it. I would almost put it in the same category as a Holiday Inn or Best Western. It seems like a mid-scale hotel doing it's best to impersonate a upper-scale. The rooms are large and very clean. I have a small black light for work and I checked the room out with it. Amazing how clean it was really. The staff was very friendly. The pool seemed a little small for such a large hotel. The internet was not free $10 a day. You can save money by signing up for boingo before your stay. Boingo is $10 a month for unlimited wireless and the Hilton is a hotspot. They have 4 PCs in the business center and wireless is also available. You may have to wait for a PC if you need one. I have stayed at most of the other hotels in downtown Indy and I think this one is close to the bottom of list. They should consider making some improvements and updating the hotel a little. I believe it would then stand up to what is excepted out of a Hilton. This hotel needs to try just a little hard then the other downtown hotels because they are not attached to Circle Center. It is only a short walk across the street but the others downtown are closer and attached. I stayed for $54 a night so I was not upset with my stay. If I would have paid the $160 a night I may have felt differently.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some updates”
Reviews.Author: mnl10221982
Reviews.Content: My husband, 1 year old son, and I stayed at the Hilton while we were visiting some friends in Indianapolis. We chose the hotel because they offer a special for members of the military and their families that seemed better than the military discounts that other Indianpolis hotels offer. However, after taxes and the cost of parking was added to our bill, we actually spent more money to stay at the Hilton than we spend to stay at some of the newer hotels because the cost of parking is included in their military discounts. The staff was very friendly and helpful for the most part. We chose valet parking. It took the valet attendent quite a while to even acknowledge us when we arrived at the hotel. After waiting for several minutes, he took our keys and unpacked our car and we were on our way to check-in. Check-in was quick and easy. We were a bit early but our room was ready. The crib we had requested was not in the room. My husband made a quick call and there was a crib delivered within minutes. It is obvious that the Hilton is an older property in Indianapolis. the decor is quite outdated. It reminded me of stepping into a lower class hotel which is not what I expected. There was no fridge to store my son's milk and juice in so we resorted to filling one of the two sinks with ice. The room, however, was large and comfortable. We had plenty of space and the bedding was clean and the bed was comfortable. The location is excellent and the hotel was easy to get to. We did not eat at the hotel so I am unable to provide information about the restaurants/room service. The menus looked delicious but pricey and we needed kid friendly dining. Overall, the hotel is average. I wouldn't be scared to go back but I will probably chose another property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackLandKY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business recently. The room was very large, and the bed comfortable. The place was quiet. There was a stain on the couch--I didn't want to know any more about that. Everything else was really nice, though. The staff was courteous, and McCormick and Schmidts off the lobby has a great happy hour ($1.95 bar menu, including a 1/2 pound burger, fried oysters, etc).
