Parking is expensive ($22/day) compared to other places downtown (I saw $13 and $15/day nearby). Overall, a nice place to stay convenient to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Indianapolis Hilton”
Reviews.Author: CSmithATLGA
Reviews.Content: Recently in Indianapolis for a convention, I had the pleasure of staying 4 nights at the Indianapolis Hilton. I couldn't have been happier. The rooms were clean and very comfortable, no noise despite the completely booked hotel, staff that were very warm and accommodating. The locale is about 2 blocks from the convention center and surrounded by lots to do and see within walking distance. Be sure to check out Alcatraz down the street for a dinner and drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruthk191
Reviews.Content: Our Girl Scout Council (Southeast Florida) traveled to Indianapolis for the 51st Convention. Like all groups coming in, we were put in a "lottery" for hotels. At first we were disappointed that we were not in one of the hotels that were adjacent to the convention center. But once we arrived, we discovered that all the rooms at the Hilton were suites! Very spaciaous with separate living and sleeping areas, a large bathroom with 2 sinks (one in and one out) and 2 TVs. Everything was always immaculate and the service staff was friendly and helpful - the doorman even helped when a cab company over charged us! Because of the busy convention schedule we never got a chance to use ammenities such as the indoor pool but the resturants were good (though the drink prices were high.) One thing we missed was a refrigerator in the room. I would definitely reccommend staying at this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: Twig
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights in August. The decor in the lobby and the bedrooms is quite plain, but it's clean and fresh looking. The lifts were excellent, I never waited more than a couple of seconds for a lift. The rooms are big and the two basins, one in the bathroom and one in the bedroom was useful. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. The pool on the top floor was nice, and it was well lit. It would have been nice to have a sun-terrace. The location is excellant, with shops, restaurants and sightseeing all within walking distance. Most of the buses stop just around the corner, for trips to the Indi racetrack or even the airport. The housekeeping wasn't very reliable. Our room was never cleaned before late afternoon, they often didn't replace the tea or sugar, one day the bed (and towels) was made up for one person instead of two, and crockery was left in the hallway for days. Even a commode, was left for several hours in the hallway. One morning I went down to breakfast at 9.10am and was told the buffet breakfast was finished. I said that I had thought it was available until 10.00, and they then said yes I could have the buffet. Someone brought me fruit juice, but then no one came toask if I wanted tea or coffee, no one cleared the plates, and I had to find someone to pay the bill. The following morning I went to breakfast 30 minutes earlier, and even then I had to wait while they relaid a table, as all the tables were made up for lunch! Not very welcoming! The restaurant serves bar meals during "happy hour" we paid 1.95$ for a cheeseburger and fries, very good value. This is a good hotel that just needs to pay a little bit more attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Colts Game Stay”
Reviews.Author: Btownboy
Reviews.Content: We came in to town to see the Colts home opener in Lucas Oil Stadium and decided to spend the night instead of driving home late. We booked on Hotwire and got a great rate for this hotel. When we arrived the desk clerks were very very cordial and friendly. We arrived around 1pm and we did not even have to ask if they had rooms ready. She put us in a King room the room was very nice and clean. It had a very comfortable bed. It had a very large bathroom. The only bad thing we were in a corner room without any window to the outside. I think we could have asked for a different room but decided it would be ok. The location is really nice right off of the monument circle and close to everything downtown. The new Lucas Oil Stadium is about the farthest thing from this hotel roughly 8-9 blocks. We will book this hotel again. Great Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, lovely, convenient”
Reviews.Author: deeindiana
Reviews.Content: We had a gift certificate for an overnight stay at the Hilton and, quite frankly, were worried that we'd be treated like second class citizens. On the contray! From the moment we arrived, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Everything about the hotel was clean, efficient and quite lovely -- from the lobby to the room. Our delux room had a king size bed, fold-out sofa and large desk. It seemed a little weird to have a sink and large lighted mirror beside the bed...but it made it quick for the two of us to get ready in the morning. If you want me to get really nit-picky: the TV is awfully far from the bed but...big deal. On Saturday night, we ate at the hotel restaurant, the 120 West Market Grill. There were only a few tables occupied and we worried about what to expect. But our meal was delicious (expensive, but delicious). The white chocolate raspberry cheesecake that we took back to the room was fabulous! The hotel was only two blocks from the Circle Memorial downtown. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for everyone”
Reviews.Author: WRRaytravel
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel room through Hotwire which saved me $40 vs the hotel site. The hotel is in the heart of downtown which means you have to pay $18 for parking. All the resteraunts and shopping are within walking distance, which was really nice. Our room was really large, I believe we had a handicap room. The didn't have free wireless internet or breakfast which I thought they could have included. The pool area wasn't the greatest for a 19 floor hotel. The pool was pretty small and the hot tub was really small. A 6 person hottub for this large hotel was crazy. The exercise room was located one floor below the pool area and it provided current equipment and assortment of tvs. The hotel wasn't bad for the price, but I would stay somewhere else next time since the pool area wasn't that great.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest 3.5 Star hotel I seen!”
Reviews.Author: Indianafarmerswife
Reviews.Content: For my latest stay in Indianapolis I booked here on Hotwire.com. At the $52 rate, I got what they call a Deluxe 2 Queen Room (really a small suite). The staff was very polite. Buffet Breakfast good and not bad price. Adjoining seafood restaurant was very good food, but slow. Self-parking is a bit pricey $19

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: BeMe50
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business and have stayed at this hotel with no issues until my latest stay in Feb. '08. Here are the "issues" I experienced: 1. My room was not vacuumed AT ALL during my stay - I was there 4 nights. 2. No towels in the bathroom, or bath mat/rug - had to call housekeeping. Housekeeping also removed my robe from the room - that was actually something I enjoyed having while there! 3. Only 1 trash can in the room - and it was very small. No mugs for the coffee maker either - had to call for those and tea bags which are usually in the room. 4. Room service was quick, but food was pretty bad. The menu had been upgraded - that was a joke. all it meant was price increases and hardly any choices. 5. I requested a menu be brought to my room with the new "upgrades" and prices. I received the same menu - not a new one, which was stained and had a worm (or maget) crawling across the pages!! To my disgust, I phone guest services and was brought yet another menu to my room which reflected the laughable "upgrades". I asked the person delivering the new menu to look at the one he had just delivered to me - it looked as though someone had pulled it out of a trash can! I should have been comped a free meal or something for this. 6. On a couple of occasions, I was not given any new toiletries, fortunately I still had some to use, and besides, I was tired of calling housekeeping/guest services. I was very disappointed in this hotel. The staff are usually courteous, and the breakfast buffet is usually good, but cleanliness is VERY important to me! Also, as a Gold Hilton Honors member, I should have free breakfast, not have to pay $4 to have eggs, etc. I also stay at Embassy Suites in different cities and they have a little basket of goodies when I arrive and 2 bottles of water. I get NOTHING at this Hilton. I am checking into other places to stay from now on - there are a lot of choices in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: dlj5
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here one night while we went to a Colts game. Great property. Staff is polite and friendly. Rooms were large and clean, updated. Great indoor pool and fitness center had new equipment. The breakfast buffet had a wide selection of good food but they were understaffed- it was a holiday weekend. Great location if you are doing things in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: JakeRM1
Reviews.Content: The Indianapolis Hilton is a fairly modern hotel in a great location. It is right down the street from Indianapolis' largest mall with lots of good eating options. Upon checking in, I was upgraded to a suite. The room was very spacious. The bed was comfortable and the showers water pressure/temperature were fine. I ordered dessert through room service a couple times. Both were very good and it came quickly. When I checked in I found a note in my room from the house keeper which I felt was inappropriate. I brought it to the attention at the front desk and moved on, it wasn't too big of a deal. When I returned from dinner that evening I had a voice mail on my room phone from the manager-on-duty profusely apologizing. He asked me to call him to discuss some more, which he did. After that, I found a hand written note under my door apologizing again and offering me a free breakfast. I felt his actions demonstrated he truly cared about my comfort during my stay. The only thing that is preventing me from giving this property five stars is the lack-luster staff. With the exception of the manager mentioned above, everyone else I interacted with was rather apathetic towards my existence. When I first pulled up, the valet was busy BSing with someone inside and took several minutes before he noticed me waiting there. Also, the consierge was never at his desk. When I needed to arrange a ride to the airport, the in-room guide of all of the hotel services said they could arrange transportation for me. When I called guest services, they said they were unable to arrange transportation but I could call a taxi. I was surprised the Hilton was not willing to make the effort to call a car service on my behalf, especially because my room guide said they did. Overall this is an excellent hotel and I would definitely stay there again. I would encourage management to spend a little more time training their staff on the intricacies of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Largest rooms I've ever stayed in....”
Reviews.Author: goldentravelbug
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for business/pleasure. We were amazed at the size of the rooms. Our room had an enormous living and dining area, 2 bathrooms and an oversized bedroom. It was like staying in an apartment - I believe it used to be apartments that were turned into a hotel. So if you're looking for space, this is the hotel. The staff was friendly, the place was clean and up to date in furnishings. Overall it was a very nice hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: gregz69
Reviews.Content: The property is located between the circle and the capital building, approximately three block north of the dome/convention center. The lobby is clean,bright and spacious. A McCormick and Schmidts is located near the front entrance as well as the hotel buffet restaurant. The staff was excellent, the valet parking is at $22 but car retrieval was very fast. The room that I had was a junior suite with two queens and a pull out sofa. The bathroom was good sized as well. The room, hall, elevators and lobby were very well maintained. I would highly recommend this hotel. In reading some of the earlier reviews, I can not believe that someone who pays $55 a night for a quality property like this should complain. You can't stay at a Red Roof for that.... I paid $170 a night and considered that a fair price for the quality of hotel that this is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP78
Reviews.Content: Overall I would say you can tell this is an old building, however they have done a good job maintaining it to keep it up to snuff. The lobby is clean and smells good, it's like that spa smell. The service was friendly and prompt. Some of the room furnishings could use updating. But overall I would definitely stay there again, and we got a great price of $109/night. Room service was expenisve but efficient. Location is excellent- right in the middle of everything and in walking distance to restaurants, mall, etc. Beds are comfortable. Not quite as good as Marriott but good. TV was small for a Hilton. Room came with robes too. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Timing”
Reviews.Author: Acts412
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival on an average Wednesday, while checking in an employee from their restaurant notified me it was customer appreciation night and there would be free bufffet appetiziers and drinks for about a 3 hour span. Well, Yippee, great timing! So as soon as I checked in I was drinking free beer and eating very good food. The overall staff was very nice and friendly. The rooms are big and cozy with a terrific bed. I slept beautifully during my stay. Very clean rooms, bathrooms a bit out dated but satifactory.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: FreeSandySprings
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Hilton Indianapolis recently, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. The rooms were very large, and very clean. There is a McCormick & Schmick's on the ground level, and it also has its own buffet-oriented restaurant on the other side of the lobby. The buffet restaurant's breakfast & lunch buffets were a little pricey for Indy, but obviously inexpensive compared to M&S's. The hotel is situated in between Monument Circle and the Indiana State Capitol, which made it very convenient to all downtown Indy attractions. I would most certainly stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not as close to convention center as other hotels”
Reviews.Author: janestclaire95
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comfortable, and clean. Our room was very large, with a suite type arrangement. I recommend this hotel for those who wish to stay in downtown Indy. Positive aspects were the cleanliness, quietness, and the large rooms with separated areas. Negatives aspects were the distance from convention center, and the lack of complimentary internet access in the rooms. The hotel is one block from the circle monument. However, it is several blocks (maybe 5-6) from the convention center. If you are attending a convention, I would recommend the Marriott or the Westin hotels more highly, as they are connected to the convention center directly and this is very convenient. The parking was quite expensive, $22 for valet/$19 for self-park. However, this is not much higher than surrounding areas. There are a number of street folks in this area, and it feels a little deserted at night. If walking alone, I would recommend taking city precautions, and be aware of your surroundings. Overall, if you must stay downtown, this is a nice hotel. However, if you plan to just visit Indy, and don't need to stay downtown, there are better values elsewhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: Jakey450
Reviews.Content: A great stay at this Hilton hotel! The room was spotlessly clean, and the bed was to die for. The staff at check-in were exceptional. When asked for recommendations and directions they were extremely happy to help. The deluxe rooms are huge in comparison to many downtown hotels. While the decor may be a little dated, there was no noticable wear or dirt. Overall, a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: SCSarah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for a meeting, and it was an overall great experience. The staff were friendly, and my room was quite spacious, well-appointed, and clean. My room service order was delivered quickly and the food was tasty and warm (well, the salad was cold!). Bed was comfy. The shower was average, and the in-room coffee maker appeared to be a "pod" machine, but it actually just brewed small, weak cups of coffee the traditional way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, with some minor problems”
Reviews.Author: sr5242
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over new years. Paid $55/nite thru priceline. Missed the entrance to self park, and had a ton of bags, so used valet. Valet is $22/nite, self park is $19, so not a huge difference. But was disappointed to find out other hotels within a block or 2 of the hilton only charge between $10-12 for self park- Radisson was $12 for self park, $18 for valet. Valet parking attendant was okay, bell man very prompt and attentive to helping unload car and bringing us to desk to check in. We switched to self park for the last 2 nights. Upon check in, we were given a room with 2 queens. We asked if we could have a king with a queen sofa. basically we were told we had the cheap rooms, and it would be an additional $51 a nite to upgrade to a king with sleeper. so we took our 2 queen bed room, and the bellman helped us upstairs to our room on the 19th floor (pool floor). upon the elevator doors opening onto the 19th floor, we were greeted by the most horrendous screaming I have ever heard. We walk over to the pool door and looked in. A large family had taken over the entire pool area, and were carrying on like it was their backyard pool party. Flips, dives, marco polo, screaming and yelling like maniacs. A small baby was floating on an inner tube in the whirlpool! Just a mess, unsafe for all involved- and no one else could possibly use the pool. I asked the bellman if there was security to deal with this. he informed me that if there was an adult present, there was nothing they could do about it. He led us to our room down the hall from the pool, where we could still clearly hear the screaming from the pool. No soundproofing at all. Were seranaded by the pool revelers until almost 11pm. Initial impression was that the room was nice, but nothing special. Basic hotel room. There was only 1 trash can in the room, and it was one of those narrow, art deco small cans that hold like 3 tissues, so most of our trash (our kids had juice boxes, toy boxes from gifts for the kids, etc) had to put placed next to the can. Room had a coffee/tea maker in the bathroom, and we used the tea bags, sugar packets, napkins, paper cups, and stirrer the first night. 2nd day, housekeeping came through, but left all the trash boxes next to the garbage can, did not replace tea packets, sugar, cups or stirrer, and left a sheled sunflower seed on the floor where there had not been one before. When I complained about the pool and bellman the morning after we arrived, the manager gave us breakfast coupons for the buffet. The food was so horrible, if I had paid I'd have demanded my money back. Eggs were undercooked, oatmeal overcooked and one large lump in the pot, poor selection of breads, and poor food presentation. Even my kids who usually love breakfast wouldn't eat any of it. Location is excellent. We could easily walk to all downtown attractions, but had to drive to zoo, speedway, and children's museum. Be aware, parking fills up quickly on game nights. We ended up taking a cab on game night, since we were afraid of moving our car and not finding a spot when we returned back. We did order room service for lunch on new yr's eve- all of which was very tasty and large portions. We ordered 2 kids' pizzas (which were large and very good), hamburgers (which were also good, and the sides with it were huge), and the homemade chips with dip (large portion and very good). The third day, the trash was still not picked up, and the tea/sugar/cups were still not replaced, so I called down asking for more tea. Someone brought up 2 tea bags, and nothing else. I've had more generous supplies at a travelodge. So as I was checking out I did mention my concerns regarding housekeeping, garbage pickup, and replenishment of supplies. Gentleman behind the counter (Jonathan) was very helpful, and took off my bill the room service and first night valet parking. So our stay was nice, just okay. I would not rate this hotel exceptional in anyway. It's about even with a hyatt. Three stars is appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: vincent
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 one weekend night in Sept and the only "complaint" was there was 1 checkout person working the desk, however it was a Sunday. Other than that I have nothing but good to say about my stay. I had a room with 2 queen beds, seperate living area and a view. There was a seperate mirror/counter area outside of the bathroom. Nice closet space with full view mirrors doors. The living area had an armoire with tv, desk area, couch and chairs. The sleeping area had an additional tv and could be closed off by the french doors. Did I mention how comfortable the bed and pillows were. I could have just relaxed the whole day. There was plenty of room to definitely spread out. I had a made to order breakfast in restaurant which was very good. Nice workout equipment and size of room. Pool and whirpool areas nice as well. Both are situated on higher floors. Self parking is $19 and I believe valet is a couple bucks more. Friendly, helpful staff. Walking distance to great restaurants, shopping and movie theatre. Great Location. Definitely would stay again. First of many more Hilton stays..

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: traveler pam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and two kids for 3 nights. We went to Indy to visit the zoo and children's museum. The Hilton is next to the state capital and monument circle at the intersection of Market and Illinois. Great location close to lots of restaurants and the Circle Centre shopping mall. We parked in the onsite garage which was $19.00 per day. The lot directly across the street on Illinois was only $12.00, but Hilton assured us they monitor their parking ramp. The hotel's bar/restaurant features $1.95 meal specials from 4-6 each evening. However, the specials are only available in the bar and no one under 21 is allowed in the bar. We were somewhat dismayed by that. Coming from the beer state, no one is turned away at a bar! We had a queen suite which was probably the largest hotel room I have ever stayed in. There were two sinks, (1 in and 1 out of bathroom) two TVs, two queen beds and a pull out sofa. There was also a nice desk/computer area for business travelers. The queen beds were separated from the sofa sleeper/desk area by french doors. The bathroom was very large. The queen beds each had 4 pillows. The weird thing was there was only 1 waste basket in the whole room. I would of expected at least 3. The kids liked the pool & hot tub. It is located on the top (19th floor). There is also a nice work out room on the 18th floor. We walked every night to Monument Circle and got ice cream at the Chocolate Cafe/South Bend Chocolate store. The steps of the monument are a great place to rest and people watch. Over the weekend it was packed. There is also an interesting FREE Civil War museum but it is closed on Mon and Tues. We ate breakfast every morning at Le Peeps, an Indy landmark. There are several locations throughout the City. The restaurant is just north of the Hilton on Illinois. Our best dinner was at Buca di Beppo almost directly across the street from Hilton on Illinois. It is a fun restaurant that is very family friendly. Their meals are served family style. I would not hesitate to go back again. The Children's museum is fantastic, well worth the trip. The zoo was also fun and has a dolphin show. The canal is a fun place to people watch as well. There are several places of interest at the White River State Park. It is where the zoo is located.
